thread.title: H&M first quarter pretax dives in line with expectations, flags more markdowns

title: H&M first quarter pretax dives in line with expectations, flags more markdowns
text: March 27, 2018 / 6:21 AM / Updated 12 minutes ago H&M first quarter pretax dives in line with expectations, flags more markdowns Reuters Staff 1 Min Read STOCKHOLM (Reuters) - Swedish fashion retailer H&M ( HMb.ST ) reported on Tuesday a fall in quarterly pretax profit that roughly matched expectations and said higher inventories would lead to increased markdowns also in the second quarter. FILE PHOTO: The logo of Swedish fashion retail group H&M is seen at a building in Dietlikon, Switzerland October 11, 2016. REUTERS/Arnd Wiegmann/File Photo Pretax profit in December through February, H&M’s fiscal first quarter, shrank 61 percent to 1.26 billion crowns (£108.24 million) from a year-ago 3.21 billion, against a mean forecast in a Reuters poll of analysts for 1.29 billion. H&M in February warned markdowns due to weak demand in many of its main H&M brand’s stores would hit earnings, and earlier this month said sales shrank for a second straight quarter, by 2 percent, sending shares down. Reporting by Anna Ringstrom and Helena Soderpalm
